intro: Cryptocarya massoy, commonly known as the New Zealand native tree, is a member of the Lauraceae family. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree that typically grows in coastal forests and shrublands. The plant has simple, alternate, elliptic to ovate leaves with a glossy upper surface and a lighter underside. Its flowers are small, greenish-white, and clustered in umbels, while the fruit is a dark blue, fleshy drupe. Cryptocarya massoy plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing food and shelter for various wildlife species.
